One thing that's been bugging me is that the Feather edit pencil icon doesn't parse immediately as a pencil to me. Here's the icon:

image.png

and here's the font-awesome one that we currently have.

image.png

I'm not sure whether others feel that way; I guess with that level of being enlarged, I don't experience the problem. But looking at screenshots like those in https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/22021, my brain sometimes parses the icon as "a line with a dot floating nearby", not a pencil.
I got your point, will get back with some variatoins
rethinking a bit all that top part

Getting back to this with clarifications of my thought process. Tell me what feels more natural to you Zulipers :smile:
I started from the feedback that the new pencil icon isn't clear. Ideally would be to not have icon at all. Topic name is a link so we could do a double click to edit, but I'm not sure you would be open to such idea.

Another radical solution that I think is better but not sure if you would be open to this is to hide all the secondary options under tricolon image.png
Mark as done might be an important action and mute topic too. So hiding it isn't obvious decision. Here I want to point out lack of consistency in the topic menu in the side bar image.png where are no rename and mark as done options.

As I showed earlier we could move away from pencil metaphor and illustrate a text input, because this is what actually happens.
image.png

Next I try to add a line under the pencil icon: image.png

At this point icons loos style consistency and I make mute icon with outlines: image.png

I'm not sure that pencil with a line improves recognition by a lot. So I use the most common icon of edit: image.png

And to reduce visual noise a little bit getting back to solid forms where possible:
image.png

I think the last works better.
Keep in mind that for Drafts we have such icon image.png

Vlad Korobov said:

Here I want to point out lack of consistency in the topic menu in the side bar image.png where are no rename and mark as done options.

Interesting, here's what I see:
image.png

There is "Move topic" and "Mark as resolved".

Maybe it's only showing those to me because I'm an admin? If we're showing those options there for admins, it seems like we should also show them for anyone who has permission to do them.

Yes, the extra options should in theory be shown to anyone who has permissions to do them. The permissions to modify topics are quite convoluted; see #21739 for a proposed fix. We can review to make sure the right users are shown those options after that issue is resolved; Sahil Batra is working on it.
I think the idea is to have the most common options that we want to keep light-weight available in the topic bar for easy access.
I would be very open to something like keeping an "edit" icon and a "resolve topic" icon, and replacing "mute topic" with a menu that includes all the other options available to the user.

If my query is right, 8.6% of non-idle Zulip Cloud users have at least one muted topic, 4.6% have more than one, and 1.3% have 10+. So even with how prominent the button is in the current UI (both in the topic bar and in Recent topics), muting a topic doesn't seem to be a particularly frequent action.

muting a topic doesn't seem to be a particularly frequent action

Yes, I think it is a rare case when I like a stream but mute a topic. And I muted that not from within a topic but from outside (left side menu), before looking into it.

I think in future it would be nice to follow topics in mutes streams

Vlad Korobov said:

I think in future it would be nice to follow topics in mutes streams

For sure! #2517
